<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_pool_is_resizable_inplace:
```c
bool
MHD_pool_is_resizable_inplace (struct MemoryPool *pool,
                               void *block,
                               size_t block_size)
{
  mhd_assert (pool->end >= pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (pool->size >= pool->end - pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (block != NULL || block_size == 0);
  mhd_assert (pool->size >= block_size);
  if (NULL != block)
  {
    const size_t block_offset = mp_ptr_diff_ (block, pool->memory);
    mhd_assert (mp_ptr_le_ (pool->memory, block));
    mhd_assert (pool->size >= block_offset);
    mhd_assert (pool->size >= block_offset + block_size);
    return (pool->pos ==
            ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE (block_offset + block_size));
  }
  return false; /* Unallocated blocks cannot be resized in-place */
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function MHD_pool_is_resizable_inplace:
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
...
#define mp_ptr_diff_(p1, p2) ((size_t)(((constuint8_t*)(p1))-((constuint8_t*)(p2))))
...
#define mp_ptr_le_(p1, p2) (((constuint8_t*)(p1))<=((constuint8_t*)(p2)))
...
#define ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE(n) ROUND_TO_ALIGN(n)
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#define ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE(n) ROUND_TO_ALIGN(n)
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment — ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE is a macro alias to ROUND_TO_ALIGN and does not introduce any function calls. A Rule 17.2 violation would only occur if there were functions that call each other cyclically (for example, if ROUND_TO_ALIGN were a function that called ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE and that in turn called ROUND_TO_ALIGN, creating indirect recursion).
